symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, may be productive or non-productive

vital_signs.oxygen_saturation: Decreased (85% on room air in one case)

physical_findings: Signs of right lower lung zone consolidation
Absence of skin or mucosa lesions (in some cases)
Diminished breath sounds on the right lung (in one case)
Grade +2 peripheral pitting edema (in one case)
Scattered purplish lesions in the abdomen and flanks (in one case)
Erythematous lesions on the proximal and distal part of the trachea and right middle lobe (bronchoscopy finding)

lab_values.CD4_count: Low (102 cells/μL (17%) in one case, 93 cells/mm3 in another, 27 cells/microliter in another, 3 cells/mm3 in another)
lab_values.HIV_RNA: Elevated (134,000 copies/mL in one case, 2,990,000 copies/mL in another)

risk_factors: African origin (increased likelihood in some studies)
Extensive cutaneous disease (may progress to visceral involvement)
Anoreceptive sexual intercourse with male partners (inconsistent barrier contraception)

CT_scan_of_chest: Diffuse fine noncalcified nodular densities in both lungs
Small to moderate bilateral axillary, mediastinal, and hilar adenopathy
Significant worsening of fibronodular infiltrates with consolidation in the right middle and lower lobes and left upper and lower lobes
Bilateral axillary, supraclavicular, mediastinal, and hilar lymphadenopathy
Para-aortic lymph nodes in the upper abdomen
Multiple bilateral, right greater than left-sided, ill-defined peribronchovascular ground-glass nodules
Significant progression of ill-defined peribronchovascular infiltrates, interlobular septal thickening, and mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy
Chest_X-ray: Moderate right lung pleural effusion with scattered bilateral diffuse infiltrates

required: Histopathologic confirmation of atypical spindle cell proliferation with slit-like vascular spaces, lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate, and extravasated red blood cells
Positive nuclear HHV-8 immunostain in atypical cells
supportive: Clinical presentation with pulmonary symptoms (cough, shortness of breath, hemoptysis, etc.)
Imaging findings (nodular densities, consolidations, pleural effusion)
Positive sequential thallium and negative gallium scintigraphy (in some cases)
